A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The phrases “Mandaral” and “I hate cats!” seem to be frequently on their lips, but they ultimately turn out to be witches who want to eat the children of the town. Hate is acted out as greatly dramatised evil.
